Description: A very successful entertainment was held in <LOCATION>Stark</LOCATION>'s school house on the evening of the 21st. The program consisted of dialogue  recitations and singing.

Public notice is hereby given to all owners of real estate and resident house holders of the municipality of the village of <LOCATION>Shawville</LOCATION> that a meeting of the municipal electors will be held in the council Hall on Monday the 14th day of January 1895 at the hour of ten o'clock in the forenoon to proceed with the election of three councillors in the room and stead of <PERSON>James Prendergast Thos</PERSON>. <PERSON>Dale</PERSON> and <PERSON>John Lester</PERSON> whose term of office has expired.

three hundred Cedars (300) delivered at the <LOCATION>Town Hall Shawville</LOCATION> or on the repspective spots where they may be wanted. Tenders will be revieved up to 10 a.m. of the 1st Monday in January 1895 for the whole or any part thereof

The members of the Baptist church showed their appreciation of the services of their worthy pastor Rev. <PERSON>J. Medcof</PERSON> by presenting him with a handsome fur coat on the afternoon of Christmas day. The ladies of the congregation went well provided with good things to which all did ample justice. Mr. <PERSON>Medcof</PERSON> was com pletely taken by surprise and replied in a feeling manner.
Mr. and Mrs. <PERSON>Ed</PERSON>. <PERSON>Graham</PERSON> entertained quite a number of invited guests Xmas night.
The members of <ORGANIZATION>Prospect Lodge</ORGANIZATION> invited the <LOCATION>Victoria Lodge</LOCATION> to attend their meeting on Christmas night.
Miss <PERSON>Holton</PERSON> of <LOCATION>Belleville</LOCATION> is spending a  few days here the guest of Miss <PERSON>McAllister</PERSON>
<PERSON>Miss L. Black</PERSON> left off school on Friday for two month's holidays and is visiting at Mrs. <PERSON>John Bradley</PERSON>'s.
Mr. <PERSON>John R. Young</PERSON> returned home Friday evening from the Hospital in <LOCATION>Ottawa</LOCATION> very little improved but seems better since.
Mr. <PERSON>Andrew Grant</PERSON> arrived home on Friday night accompanied my Miss <PERSON>J. McPherson</PERSON> of Almonte.
Mr. <PERSON>William Shaw</PERSON> has removed his household effects to <LOCATION>Ottawa</LOCATION> where he intends residing for the future.

Public notice is hereby given that it is the intention of the <ORGANIZATION>Municipal Council</ORGANIZATION> of the Township of <LOCATION>Bristol</LOCATION> to examine and honologate at its sittings in the townhall on Monday the 7th day of January 1895 at the hour of ten in the forenoon the Proces Verbal of the old Ragged CHute Road ordered by resolution of the <ORGANIZATION>Council</ORGANIZATION> on Monday the 5th day of November 1894.

A very pleasant time was spent at the home of Mr. <PERSON>Richard Hynes</PERSON> on Monday evening last. The guests began to assemble about 7 o'clock and continued coming until a goodly number were present. Games of all kinds were indulged in; music and singing was also a favourite passtime of the evening whilst others seem to enjoy very much the sweet tones of the hand-organ. As the New Year was ushering in  the guests were doing justice to a large variety of choice refreshments. Supper being ended wishes for a bright and happy new year retired to their respective homes went on for a short time. Then the young folks having recieved and given many good
The remains of the late widow <PERSON>Sinclair</PERSON> were interred in the Anglican burial ground here on Monday
Mr. and Mrs. <PERSON>Alex Bell</PERSON> of <ORGANIZATION>Sturgeon Falls Ont</ORGANIZATION>. Are spending the holidays with friends in <LOCATION>N.O.</LOCATION> and Quyon.
Mr. <PERSON>John Turner</PERSON> left again last week for the west.
At <PERSON>M. Kane</PERSON>'s has arrived a boy visitor whom I hear intends to stay.
Men and teams are leaving for the woods daily.
Mr. <PERSON>P. Kane</PERSON> of <LOCATION>Hazelhurst Wis</LOCATION>. Arrived home last week and intends remaining for the winter months.
Mr. <PERSON>F. Hearty</PERSON> spent the holidays with friends in <PERSON>Vinton</PERSON>. Welcome back F. how "she" missed you.

Mr. <PERSON>J.H. Brownlee</PERSON> wishes to announce that the Shawville skating rink is now running and will be open every week night (except Fridays) weather permitting during the season. A carnival will be held in the near future regarding which posters will be issued in a day or two.
Revival meetings are going on here now at <LOCATION>Craig</LOCATION>'s <LOCATION>Church.</LOCATION>
Miss <PERSON>Maggie Martin</PERSON> is visiting at Mrs. <PERSON>J. Bradley</PERSON>'s.

Miss <PERSON>Carey</PERSON> of the <LOCATION>Fort</LOCATION> is spending the holidays at Mr. <PERSON>Robert Smart</PERSON>'s.
An amateur fox hunt took place at <LOCATION>Elmside</LOCATION>
The annual congregational meeting of the Presbyterian church was held on Friday evening 28th and notwithstanding the severity of the weather was well attended
Mrs. <PERSON>E. Graham</PERSON> gave a six o'clock dinner to a number of her many friends
Miss <PERSON>C. Dunkerley</PERSON> late principal of the academy is visiting her acquaintances here this week

Miss <PERSON>Amelia Smart</PERSON> is home for the holidays
The Ven. <PERSON>Archdeacon Naylor</PERSON> has been holding a series of cottage meetings which are well attended and appreciated.
<PERSON>Mrs Wm. Lochart</PERSON> and two daughters from <LOCATION>Edmonton</LOCATION> are visiting friends here.
Mr. <PERSON>F. S. Roy</PERSON> is spending a few days at home.

Mr. <PERSON>Syvanus Richards</PERSON> of <LOCATION>Arnprior</LOCATION> is visiting friends here at the present.
Miss <PERSON>Grace McKechnie</PERSON> spent a few days in <LOCATION>Elmside</LOCATION> last week.
A few of our sportsmen tried to make Xmas a little exciting by organizing a fox hunt.
Mr. <PERSON>Alex Stewart</PERSON> returned home a few days ago and intends remaining with us.
Miss <PERSON>Jessie McPherson</PERSON> of <PERSON>Almonte</PERSON> is visiting friends here
Mr. <PERSON>W. Finlan</PERSON> and sister Miss <PERSON>Mary</PERSON> spent a few days in <LOCATION>Renfrew</LOCATION> last week. The Misses <PERSON>Finlan</PERSON> are home for their holidays.
Mr. <PERSON>Eddie Larivee</PERSON> just landed in town to spend <LOCATION>New Year.</LOCATION>
Mr. <PERSON>S. Richard</PERSON> and daughter Miss <PERSON>Jennie May</PERSON> are visiting friends at <LOCATION>Elmside.</LOCATION>
Mrs. <PERSON>Ale McDonald</PERSON> and daughter Miss <PERSON>Mabel</PERSON> of <LOCATION>Pembroke</LOCATION> is visiting her father Mr. <PERSON>R. Campbell</PERSON>
Mr. <PERSON>J.Y. Caldwell</PERSON> manager of <ORGANIZATION>W.C. Gibson</ORGANIZATION>'s biscuit factory was presented with a gold headed cane by the employes of the above named firm last week

Miss <PERSON>Grace McKechnie</PERSON> principal of Thurso public school Miss MacIntosh teacher of no. 8 school <PERSON>Clarendon</PERSON> were visiting at Mr <PERSON>James Armstrong</PERSON>'s last week.

Parties are all the rage around here just now: On Xmas night Mr. <PERSON>Edward Graham</PERSON> welcomes the juvenile host and gave a party. Saturday night saw one at Mr. <PERSON>Andrew Grant</PERSON>'s. Monday night we took possession of Mr. <PERSON>McKechnie</PERSON>'s house and paid our last respects to the old year by seeing it out. Tuesday night we are billed for Mr. <PERSON>William Graham</PERSON>'s and Wednesday night wind up at Mr. <PERSON>Lothian</PERSON>'s to give <PERSON>George</PERSON> a lively send off before he returns to <LOCATION>Ottawa</LOCATION> to resume his studies.
A watch service was held in the Methodist church here on New Year's eve.

<PERSON>Tom</PERSON> and <PERSON>Billy</PERSON> and <PERSON>Artie</PERSON> and <PERSON>Harry of Quio</PERSON> put up for an hour or so in the village whilst on their way to the concert at <PERSON>Bryson</PERSON> on New Year's.

There was a very large attendance at the social held at the parsonage on New Year night. A good program of music and addresses by the <PERSON>Archdeacon</PERSON> and Rev. <PERSON>A. Elliott</PERSON> and Mr. <PERSON>T.J. Wilson</PERSON> embraced the chief features of the evening's entertainment.

The concert at <LOCATION>Bryson</LOCATION> on New Year night is reported to have been a very successful affair. The hall was well filled and the program  supplied by local talent strongly reinforced by a contingent of <LOCATION>Pembroke</LOCATION> amateurs was well selected and excellently rendered throughout. The net receipts amounted to $35.
Several of our young people attended the concert at <LOCATION>Bryson</LOCATION> on New Year's night.
Father <PERSON>Dawson</PERSON> one of the best known and most respected priante in the <LOCATION>Ottawa Valley</LOCATION> died at <LOCATION>Ottawa</LOCATION> on Saturday aged 86 years.
Mr. <PERSON>R.W. Hodgins</PERSON> late teacher of the Model school spent Saturday in this village.

Mr. <PERSON>W. G. Bradford</PERSON> of the Thorne Methodist circuit spent his Xmas holidays at <LOCATION>Listowel</LOCATION> Ont. The <ORGANIZATION>Listowel Banner</ORGANIZATION> states that our young friend had consented to conduct the services in the Baptist church there on Sunday 30th in the absence of the pastor.
Mr. <PERSON>Elliott</PERSON> of <PERSON>Haley</PERSON>'s station preached in Zion church on Sunday 30th.

a Xmas tree held here Dec 21st. The evening was favourable and the audience all that could be desired to make the entertainment a success. The proceeds amounted to $20 to be applied towards building a woodshed school

as provided for by the terms of the Dominion Electoral Franchise Act. The revision of the lists for this village and the municipality of <LOCATION>Clarendon</LOCATION> took place on Tuesday last.

Mr. <PERSON>J. H. Brownlee</PERSON> proprietor of the Shawville skating rink wishes it to be / announced that he will give a carnival on Saturday night of this week to the boys and girls under 16 years of age. Admission to spectators over that age (except ticket holders who will be admitted free) will be 10 cents. The carnival will be open at 7 o'clock. Ice will be open to all skaters at half past 8 o'clock. It is hoped that a goodly number of the juvenile skaters of the village will avail themselves of this opportunity to appear in costume.

In consequence of the illness of Rev. Mr. <PERSON>Dilworth</PERSON> that rev. gentleman was unable to conduct the service in <LOCATION>St. Paul</LOCATION>'s church on Sunday morning last as announced therefore none was held till evening when the Rev. <PERSON>J. L. Flanagan</PERSON> officiated.

Our heart goes forth in the deepest of sympathy to our confrere Mr. W. . Cliff editor and proprietor of the <ORGANIZATION>Carleton Place Central</ORGANIZATION> Canadian who has been called upon to sustain a great affliction in the death of his beloved wife which took place on Monday last after a short but severe illness

On Wednesday the 16th a large number of our most influential citizens called at the domicile of our very obliging and efficient and ever painstaking bus driver Mr. <PERSON>Wm Richardson</PERSON> and presented him with a handsomely filled purse and a suitable bag for his business as a token of their most sincere appreciation for his faithfulness and strict attention to duty
